title: New photos show damage at condo taken 36 hours before collapse
description: Miami Herald reporter Sarah Blaskey shares photos taken by a contractor just 36 hours before the Champlain Towers condo building collapsed showing damage and standing water in the basement-level parking garage.

title: NCAA takes big step toward allowing athletes to profit from name, image or likeness
description: In a major step, the NCAA Division I Council voted Monday to support an interim policy that would allow college athletes to profit off their name, image and likeness (NIL) without violating NCAA rules until federal legislation or new NCAA rules are adopted.

title: Switzerland stuns France in Euro 2020
description: Switzerland stunned reigning world champion France with victory in a nerve-shredding penalty shootout to book its place in the Euro 2020 quarterfinals.

title: Remote or office work? The strategies are varied
description: As companies implement post pandemic work plans, some businesses are allowing hybrid options while others want employees back in the office full time. CNN's Anna Stewart reports.

title: John Oliver exposes loophole in US health care system that targets evangelicals
description: John Oliver investigated healthcare sharing ministries on his show "Last Week Tonight." As a bit, Oliver set up his own fake ministry called "JohnnyCare."

title: Lil Nas X ends his BET Awards performance with smooch
description: Singer Lil Nas X ended his BET Awards performance by kissing one of his backup dancers. Later, he shot down homophobic comments on Twitter.

title: Watch new footage released by China's Mars rover
description: China's National Space Administration has released footage of its Zhurong rover landing and exploring Mars.

title: Ford gives classic SUV a makeover
description: Ford is going after Jeep Wrangler's niche with the new Bronco. CNN Business' Peter Valdes-Dapena shows what it can do over steep hills, through creeks, and over rocks.

title: Navid Afkari: Executed Iranian wrestling star's voice is 'everywhere now'
description: It was the worst news that anybody could have woken up to; as Sardar Pashaei reached for his phone one morning in September, he knew immediately that something terrible had happened.

title: Cardi B debuts baby bump at BET Awards
description: "Blackish" star Marsai Martin said it for us: "Okay, Bardi with the baby bump!"

title: Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Lofven resigns in wake of no-confidence vote
description: Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Lofven said on Monday he had handed in his notice of resignation, giving parliament's speaker the job of finding a new premier after the Social Democrat leader lost a vote of no-confidence last week.

title: Biden's frantic weekend saves infrastructure deal but leaves him on thinner political ice
description: That Joe Biden's cherished bipartisan infrastructure plan was nearly destroyed by a few of his own ill-chosen words highlights both the fragility of the deal and his own hopes for a productive domestic presidency.

title: First on CNN: US ships first Pfizer vaccine doses abroad, donating 2 million to Peru
description: The United States on Monday will begin shipping its first doses of Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine abroad as part of the Biden administration's pledge to donate millions of vaccine doses to other countries, a White House official told CNN.

title: Officials begin inspections of nearby buildings after Florida condo collapse leaves 9 dead and more than 100 missing
description: Rescue crews have descended upon the coastal town of Surfside, Florida, as families wait for any news -- good or bad -- about their loved ones following the collapse of a condo building.

title: Honig: Don't buy Bill Barr's latest story about the Big Lie
description: William Barr's image rehabilitation tour has begun. Don't buy it.

title: Prestigious photo prize honors docu-fiction on India's hidden war
description: Photographer Poulomi Basu hopes that her images of a bloody, under reported war in India won't just raise awareness -- she wants the pictures, which intentionally blur the line between truth and fiction, to push viewers to take action for racial, gender and environmental justice.

title: Tesla hits another 'bump in the road' in China with huge recall
description: Tesla's bad run in China is getting worse.

title: Biden directs airstrikes against facilities used by Iran-backed militia groups
description: President Joe Biden directed military forces to conduct defensive precision airstrikes against facilities used by Iran-backed militia groups in the Iraq-Syria border region on Sunday evening, according to a news release from the Department of Defense.

title: Burberry shares tumble after CEO resigns to join rival
description: Marco Gobbetti, who led a turnaround at Burberry, will leave the British luxury fashion label at the end of this year to return to Italy where he'll head up rival Salvatore Ferragamo.

title: North Koreans 'heartbroken' by Kim's purported weight loss, Pyongyang resident tells state media
description: North Korean state television aired an unusual interview Friday in which a Pyongyang resident said he and others living in the capital were "heartbroken" to see how much weight the country's leader Kim Jong Un had lost.

title: North Korean media airs unusual interview about Kim Jong Un's weight loss
description: North Korean state television aired an unusual interview in which a Pyongyang resident said he and others living in the capital were "heartbroken" over Kim Jong Un's weight loss. CNN's Paula Hancocks reports.

title: Life after the 1918 flu has lessons for our post-pandemic world
description: A widespread sense that time has split into two -- or pandemics creating a "before" and "after" -- is an experience that's associated with many traumatic events.

title: Sydney McLaughlin obliterates women's 400m hurdles world record in a day of record heat
description: American athlete Sydney McLaughlin obliterated the women's 400m hurdles world record at the US Olympic trials on Sunday.

title: BET Awards 2021: See who won
description: The BET Awards, honoring Black excellence in entertainment and sports, were presented Sunday.

title: Sydney in lockdown, borders shut and hardly anyone vaccinated. How long can Australia go on like this?
description: • Opinion: I tested positive for Covid-19 twice in two cities. The responses were vastly different

title: The photographer exposing the secret life of plants
description: Neil Bromhall is a patient man. The Emmy-winning wildlife photographer doesn't so much wait months for the perfect shot as spend months making them. He is at the whims of nature, and nature is not to be hurried.

title: Lil Nas X wows BET Awards red carpet in elaborate gown
description: Lil Nas X took the BET Awards red carpet by storm Sunday, stepping out in two bold gender-fluid outfits before performing in an ancient Egypt-inspired look.

title: These are the pockets of the US most at risk as the Delta Covid-19 variant spreads, expert says
description: The Delta variant, a strain of Covid-19 believed to be more transmissible and dangerous than others, is likely to break out in some US communities, a health expert told CBS's Face the Nation.

title: What China's extensive coverage of the Miami condo collapse says about its own priorities
UEFA denies banning rainbow flags in Budapest for Netherlands vs. Czech Republic match
Tour de France spectator causes massive crash
China's latest mega-airport is officially open
description: China's long-awaited Chengdu Tianfu International Airport has officially begun operations, offering travelers a new gateway to the home of giant pandas.

title: Nude sunbathers running from deer fined for violating Sydney lockdown
description: Two men in Australia have been fined $760 each for violating Sydney's latest round of lockdowns after police found them naked and lost in the bush as they apparently fled from a wild animal.

title: Simone Biles secures spot on United States Gymnastics team for next month's Tokyo Olympics
description: Simone Biles has secured a spot on the United States Gymnastics team for next month's Tokyo Olympics.

title: Indonesia and US building maritime training center on edge of South China Sea
description: Indonesia and the United States have broken ground on a new $3.5 million maritime training center in the strategic area of Batam, in the Riau Islands, Indonesia's maritime security agency said.

title: I tested positive for Covid-19 twice in two cities. The responses were vastly different
description: As someone who has tested positive for Covid-19 in both Britain and Hong Kong, I've experienced the worst of both worlds.

title: Police identify all 5 people killed in a hot-air balloon crash in New Mexico
description: All five victims in Saturday's fatal hot-air balloon wreck have been identified, authorities in Albuquerque, New Mexico, said.

title: Former Skid Row singer Johnny Solinger dies
description: Former Skid Row singer Johnny Solinger has died, according to a post on the Official Skid Row Instagram page. He was 55.

title: Man shot in the back in Times Square, NYPD says
description: A 21-year-old man was the unintended victim of a shooting in New York's Times Square on Sunday evening, according to police.

title: Czech President calls transgender people 'disgusting'
description: Czech President Milos Zeman called transgender people "disgusting" in an interview on CNN affiliate CNN Prima News on Sunday, during a discussion of a controversial new law in Hungary.

title: Signs of the new US-China Cold War
description: • What China's extensive coverage of the Miami condo collapse says about its own priorities
